meanings.definition: Give evidence as a witness in a court of law.
meanings.sent1: She will be testifying in court tomorrow about what she saw.
meanings.sent2: The witness was testifying about the events of that fateful day.
meanings.sent3: While testifying, the witness accidentally spilled water on the judge's desk.
meanings.sent4: Her tears while testifying painted a vivid picture of the emotional turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The clarity in her voice while testifying left no doubt in the minds of the jury.

meanings.definition: Serve as evidence or proof of something.
meanings.sent1: The fingerprints on the weapon were testifying to the suspect's involvement.
meanings.sent2: The recovered documents were testifying to the authenticity of the claim.
meanings.sent3: The missing piece of the puzzle was testifying to the culprit's identity.
meanings.sent4: The scars on his body were testifying to the hardships he had endured.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph was testifying to the history of the family.

meanings.definition: Make a statement based on personal knowledge or belief.
meanings.sent1: I will be testifying in the meeting about the new project proposal.
meanings.sent2: The expert was testifying on the effectiveness of the treatment.
meanings.sent3: She was testifying confidently about her favorite book during the book club meeting.
meanings.sent4: His actions were testifying loudly against his words.
meanings.sent5: The student was testifying enthusiastically about the benefits of studying abroad.
